verses.verse: The LORD <S%H3068><s%> showed <S%H7200><s%> me, and, behold, <S%H2009><s%> two <S%H8147><s%> baskets <S%H1736><s%> of figs <S%H8384><s%> were set <S%H3259><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> the temple <S%H1964><s%> of the LORD, <S%H3068><s%> after <S%H310><s%> that Nebuchadrezzar <S%H5019><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> of Babylon <S%H894><s%> had carried <S%H1540><s%> away captive <S%H1540><s%> Jeconiah <S%H3204><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Jehoiakim <S%H3079><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> of Judah, <S%H3063><s%> and the princes <S%H8269><s%> of Judah, <S%H3063><s%> with the carpenters <S%H2796><s%> and smiths, <S%H4525><s%> from Jerusalem, <S%H3389><s%> and had brought <S%H935><s%> them to Babylon. <S%H894><s%>

One <S%H259><s%> basket <S%H1731><s%> had very <S%H3966><s%> good <S%H2896><s%> figs, <S%H8384><s%> even like the figs <S%H8384><s%> that are first <S%H1073><s%> ripe: and the other <S%H259><s%> basket <S%H1731><s%> had very <S%H3966><s%> naughty <S%H7451><s%> figs, <S%H8384><s%> which <S%H834><s%> could not be eaten, <S%H398><s%> they were so bad. <S%H7451><s%>

Then said <S%H559><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%> to me, What <S%H4100><s%> see <S%H7200><s%> you, Jeremiah? <S%H3414><s%> And I said, <S%H559><s%> Figs; <S%H8384><s%> the good <S%H2896><s%> figs, <S%H8384><s%> very <S%H3966><s%> good; <S%H2896><s%> and the evil, <S%H7451><s%> very <S%H3966><s%> evil, <S%H7451><s%> that cannot <S%H3808><s%> be eaten, <S%H398><s%> they are so evil. <S%H7455><s%>
Again the word <S%H1697><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%> came <S%H1961><s%> to me, saying, <S%H559><s%>

Thus <S%H3541><s%> said <S%H559><s%> the LORD, <S%H3068><s%> the God <S%H430><s%> of Israel; <S%H3478><s%> Like these <S%H428><s%> good <S%H2896><s%> figs, <S%H8384><s%> so <S%H3651><s%> will I acknowledge <S%H5234><s%> them that are carried <S%H1546><s%> away captive <S%H1546><s%> of Judah, <S%H3063><s%> whom <S%H834><s%> I have sent <S%H7971><s%> out of this <S%H2088><s%> place <S%H4725><s%> into the land <S%H776><s%> of the Chaldeans <S%H3778><s%> for their good. <S%H2896><s%>

For I will set <S%H7760><s%> my eyes <S%H5869><s%> on them for good, <S%H2896><s%> and I will bring <S%H7725><s%> them again <S%H7725><s%> to this <S%H2063><s%> land: <S%H776><s%> and I will build <S%H1129><s%> them, and not pull <S%H2040><s%> them down; and I will plant <S%H5193><s%> them, and not pluck <S%H5428><s%> them up.

And I will give <S%H5414><s%> them an heart <S%H3820><s%> to know <S%H3045><s%> me, that I am the LORD: <S%H3068><s%> and they shall be my people, <S%H5971><s%> and I will be their God: <S%H430><s%> for they shall return <S%H7725><s%> to me with their whole <S%H3605><s%> heart. <S%H3820><s%>

And as the evil <S%H7451><s%> figs, <S%H8384><s%> which <S%H834><s%> cannot <S%H3808><s%> be eaten, <S%H398><s%> they are so evil; <S%H7455><s%> surely <S%H3588><s%> thus <S%H3541><s%> said <S%H559><s%> the LORD, <S%H3068><s%> So <S%H3651><s%> will I give <S%H5414><s%> Zedekiah <S%H6667><s%> the king <S%H4428><s%> of Judah, <S%H3063><s%> and his princes, <S%H8269><s%> and the residue <S%H7611><s%> of Jerusalem, <S%H3389><s%> that remain <S%H7604><s%> in this <S%H2063><s%> land, <S%H776><s%> and them that dwell <S%H3427><s%> in the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt: <S%H4714><s%>

And I will deliver <S%H5414><s%> them to be removed <S%H2189><s%> into all <S%H3605><s%> the kingdoms <S%H4467><s%> of the earth <S%H776><s%> for their hurt, <S%H7451><s%> to be a reproach <S%H2781><s%> and a proverb, <S%H4912><s%> a taunt <S%H8148><s%> and a curse, <S%H7045><s%> in all <S%H3605><s%> places <S%H4725><s%> where <S%H834><s%> <S%H8033><s%> I shall drive <S%H5080><s%> them.

And I will send <S%H7971><s%> the sword, <S%H2719><s%> the famine, <S%H7458><s%> and the pestilence, <S%H1698><s%> among them, till <S%H5704><s%> they be consumed <S%H8552><s%> from off <S%H5921><s%> the land <S%H127><s%> that I gave <S%H5414><s%> to them and to their fathers. <S%H1><s%>
